availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, merchant and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Childers Lucas in July 1833. Father of Elizabeth Lucas, Mary Louise Lucas, Adeline Lucas, Queen Victoria Lucas, and Prudence M. Lucas. Married to Martha E. Dunn Lucas on September 25, 1855. Merchant in Williamstown, Kentucky, in 1850. Postmaster at Williamstown from September 28, 1853, to January 14, 1858. Sheriff of Grant County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Grant County in 1860.
